intro: Lepidium turczaninowii, commonly known as the Turk's cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its seeds are small and contain essential oils, which contribute to its aromatic properties. Lepidium turczaninowii is native to regions of Central Asia and the Himalayas.
